text: Richard Karn (born February 17, 1956) is an American actor and game show host. He is best known for acting as Al Borland in the 1990s ABC sitcom Home Improvement,Schwed, Mark: "This Handyman's Special" TV Guide, December 17, 1994 and for hosting Family Feud during the 2000s. He was born in Seattle, Washington. Karn became host of Family Feud in September 2002. He left in 2006 and was replaced by John O'Hurley. He also hosted GSN's Bingo America in 2008.Davis, Alex. "Richard Karn is New Host of 'Bingo America'", 22 August 2008. He replaced Patrick Duffy, who hosted the show for the first season. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:American television actors Category:American game show hosts Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Seattle
title: Richard Karn
